prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what topics do you typically engage with in these spaces?
I typically join and talk to others in gaming and technology forums.
What other subjects or hobbies do you enjoy exploring or learning about outside of gaming and technology?
Sometimes I like to read about politics.
What types of books, movies, or TV shows do you enjoy, and how do these interests influence what you like to read about online?
I've been watching The Witcher on Netflix. Game of Thrones is my favorite TV show.
What types of music, podcasts, or other audio content do you enjoy, and how does this influence the topics you're interested in reading about online?
Mostly news, politics, gaming, and technology podcasts.
Can you share any specific topics or issues within politics, gaming, and technology that you find particularly intriguing or that you often find yourself reading more about?
Recently I have been listening to lots of discussion about the Microsoft Vs FTC case.

What types of articles or discussions related to environmental or social issues do you find yourself drawn to, and how do these topics intersect with your interests in gaming, technology, and politics?
Nothing really.
What types of science or history topics do you find interesting, and how do these subjects relate to your interests in gaming, technology, and politics?
I like hearing stories about wars and conflicts throughout history. This does not relate to my interest in gaming or technology. But I can see parallels to politics.
What types of art, design, or creative content do you enjoy, and how does this influence your interests in gaming, technology, and politics?
I am not sure that I have a favorite type of art. I do appreciate designs that are simple and yet creative.
What types of travel destinations or cultural experiences interest you, and how might these interests influence the types of articles or discussions you engage with online?
I like to travel and I do not do it as much as I want to. I enjoy going on a beach vacation at least once a year. I enjoy going to national parks for long hikes also.
What types of health, wellness, or fitness activities do you engage in, and how do these interests influence the types of articles or discussions you seek out online?
Long hikes, running, some weight training at home.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes

feedback.feedback_other: It was stated that the chatbot wouldn't really interact... and it definitely did not. I would have expected some comments like, "Oh long hikes at National Parks must be fun." Thank you.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
